Articles.Content:
17 hours ago, NSEP said:

I hate the Nimby (Not in my backyard) Syndrome.

There are people trying to stop a gaint windmill park several kilometers away from the coast. What is their reason? "It looks ugly". Im being serious right now, thats what they actually say. They try to stop a project that is going to make our country less reliant on fossil fuels because it look ugwy? Thats stupid and pathetic, oh, and not just that, the people who say these things probably haven't seen an offshore windmill park before. Offshore windmill parks only occupy the horizon, and don't gobble up the entire view. In don't get how such big human achievements in technology are 'ugly' neither. Its amazing that people with little hands worked thousands of years to learn about the forces of nature and found out how to gather energy from the wind, isn't it?

Another reason i hate Nimby is because people didn't like the looks of the air conditioning system on the top of our school, so they had it removed, and now, whenever its hot, the school turns into a giant oven.

I for one welcome our wonderful wind turbine power generators.

I thing they're majestic.

1 hour ago, Dman979 said:

Guys, when I say "Just a quick reminder to stay away from politics on the forums. I've hidden some posts," I mean it. There were more politics in this thread, and now there are more hidden posts.

Knock it off.

 

I need to find a way to not mention politics 24/7... I'll rephrase my political post:

I don't like overly argumentative people. They generally don't know jack squat about what they're talking about. This is also the reason I like this forum: smart people talking about smart people things (mostly) in a (mostly) smart people way.

2 hours ago, Gyrfalcon5 said:

I can tell you why: It marks the location of greedy, incompetent mega-corporations!

Without which, you'd be walking your sorry butt all over the place rather than riding in a car or bus or whatever... not to mention the wonders of plastics, pharmaceuticals, and let's not forget computers..... you wouldn't even be here in these forums.

Foolishness.

9 minutes ago, LordFerret said:

Without which, you'd be walking your sorry butt all over the place rather than riding in a car or bus or whatever... not to mention the wonders of plastics, pharmaceuticals, and let's not forget computers..... you wouldn't even be here in these forums.

Foolishness.

Ughh. I really need to stop staying up so late. I can't reason! Anyway, yeah I was a little short sighted with that one... I guess I've been paying to much attention to the stunts that EA are pulling as of late. I should probably stop thinking about them altogether. 

But this is a complaint thread. Ummm... MY TEA IS COLD!!!!

2 minutes ago, Gyrfalcon5 said:

MY TEA IS COLD!!!! 

I can totally relate. Sitting here reading through threads, my coffee always surprises me on my next sip - cold.

3 hours ago, Gyrfalcon5 said:

I can tell you why: It marks the location of greedy, incompetent mega-corporations!

Reminds me of family. So many of my family worked on oil pumps. It was a job. They paid well, took care of their employees. I don't like the mentality of some of the big companies any more than you do, but they still keep the gears of modern society lubed (in this case, literally), and they still provide a means to those with families or even just selves to provide for.

I know people like to point fingers at EA, or at the big oil conglomerates... They are definitely in it for profit, and they definitely will step right over their consumers to bring in the almighty dollar/euro/yen/etc... But if you want actual evil in corporate form... Monsanto. I'll just leave you to do most of your own research, but here are a few details. Forty percent of the world's genetically modified (GM) crops are grown in the US, where Monsanto controls approximately 80 percent of the GM corn market, and about 93 percent of the GM soy market. They create near monopolies out of food crops by forcing farmers to sign away their right to lawfully retain seed, forcing them into a cycle of annual repurchasing. They are most notorious for actively pursuing damaging legal action against farmers that don't buy their product, or who legally process heirloom seeds, by claiming they are violating their patents when pollen blows in from other farms, cross pollenating plants that end up on said farms... And yet, when people question their desires to introduce crops with genes that produce infertile seeds (good ONLY for consumption, not replanting), they claim there is no risk of cross contamination with non GMO plants (something that could destroy heirloom seed varieties, rendering them infertile)... This is, of course, in spite of their numerous legal cases attacking farmers who have been the unfortunate recipients of neighbor's GM pollen... That is reaching evil villain tier, right there!!

51 minutes ago, Gyrfalcon5 said:

MY TEA IS COLD!!!! 

I don't even like tea! The one time I thought I'd manage to come up with a tea that I liked, it was some sort of Pomegranate tea, and I love pomegranates. I even had an actual pomegranate and I got the flesh out and was gonna make some sort of super tea + fruit concoction... It never made it to my mouth. Glass, tea, fruit bits, scattered and shattered all over the floor. I never even bothered to try recreating the fruit-tea experiment. I still have never tasted a tea that I liked... 

Edited May 18, 2018 by richfiles

Even worse than NIMBY is BANANA: Build Absolutely Nothing Anywhere Near Anyone!

You can thank the most recent Windows 10 update...

Adsii, you gave me something else to complain about!! My laptop really wants to update to the latest version of windows 10. But it doesn't have enough space to do it (it wants 8gb but I generally only have a gigabyte available). It just does these exact steps:

1. Tries to download the latest version.

2. Realises it can't.

3. Waits a while.

4. Repeat from step 1.

IT'S SO ANNOYING!!!

One of the reasons Windows 10 pushed me to get as far away from Windows as possible was the mandatory updates.  Microsoft's "No is not an answer" attitude is completely unacceptable.

 

Linux updates what I want, when I want, and that's all there is to it.  No forced torrent updates.

2 hours ago, RealKerbal3x said:

Adsii, you gave me something else to complain about!! My laptop really wants to update to the latest version of windows 10. But it doesn't have enough space to do it (it wants 8gb but I generally only have a gigabyte available). It just does these exact steps:

1. Tries to download the latest version.

2. Realises it can't.

3. Waits a while.

4. Repeat from step 1.

IT'S SO ANNOYING!!!

You can go into your Windows Updates settings via the Control Panel and tell it to forget that update. You'll not see it again. To do this, click on the 'Select updates to install' option... find the update in question in the list... right-click on it and select 'Hide'. Done.
